Electricity markets are a subset of energy markets that specifically deal with the buying and selling of electricity. They facilitate the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity to meet the demand of consumers.
relations.Subject: electricity markets

relations.Description: Natural gas markets are a component of energy markets that focus on the trading of natural gas. They involve the buying, selling, and transportation of natural gas to fulfill the energy needs of various sectors.
relations.Subject: natural gas markets

relations.Description: Renewable energy markets encompass the buying and selling of renewable energy resources, such as solar, wind, hydro, and geothermal energy. These markets promote the adoption and utilization of sustainable energy sources.
relations.Subject: renewable energy markets

relations.Description: Carbon markets are a specialized segment of energy markets that focus on the trading of carbon credits or allowances. They aim to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by creating economic incentives for emission reductions.
relations.Subject: carbon markets

relations.Description: Commodity markets include the trading of energy commodities, such as crude oil, natural gas, coal, and refined petroleum products. These markets play a crucial role in determining energy prices and supply-demand dynamics.
relations.Subject: commodity markets
